lexUnit.name: steal.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move somewhere quietly or surreptitiously

sentence.text: She grew bolder and stole a wee bit further into the garden .
Oblivious of any guards , she stole downstairs .
He got up and stole across the grass .
Loneliness stole across him at the strangest times .
A look of watchfulness stole across Jane Pargeter 's eyes .
His mouth caught hers again , and this time the tip of his tongue stole across her lips .
The mist obscures their support crews and steals blankly between the men and the homes in which they will sleep .
Then she gathered up her scattered clothing and stole from the room .
But as the pony trotted on under the cloud-filled November sky the voice that soon stole into Abie Klugman 's mind was not from his past or his future , but from his present .
In spite of this , those actors who stole into the auditorium between entrances returned full of enthusiasm .
She frowned , not understanding at first , then felt a faint flush steal into her cheeks as his meaning became clear .
He wanted to feel warmed through to his spine , to have the comfort steal into him like strong ale .
Never would he forget the walk home along the promenade afterwards when her delicate little hand , albeit gloved , stole into his .
He washed and dressed quietly and stole into the kitchen , only to find Zelah making coffee .
A flush stole into Lucy 's cheeks as she snapped coldly , ` In that case , better luck next time . "
A flicker of rebellion stole into her mind and , as if it had needed that impetus , one clear thought struggled free .
One thumb stole into her mouth , for comfort .
In these two species the parasite queen , all alone , steals into the nest of another ant species .
And on that note , we fold up our tents of correspondence and steal gladly into the night -- DQ
Twice Cantona stole into position at the far post waiting in vain for crosses .
Celia stole into his room one day while he was out at work .
He flicked a cassette player on the dashboard , and the soft , haunting strains of a ballad stole into the silence between them .
And yet , despite it all , I felt peace stealing into my soul .
A drowsiness stole over him .
A coldness stole over Ruth -- inexplicably familiar , like a half-stirred memory .
Ducking under the windows and stealing past the open doors , I stared out across the vegetable terrace , then walked round it .
She stole past his door with even greater care , unsure whether he was sleeping alone tonight .
It was an eerie feeling to be stealing through the forest like this .
In the end , it was relatively easy to steal through the darkened halls of Tara and out into the night .
David took Hayley 's hand in his , and Juliet felt a strange warmth steal through her , and a pang of some emotion she did n't recognise .
The harpsichord began a long lute-stop passage , a new movement , as gentle as rain , the sounds stealing through the house , mysterious , remote-sounding harmonies .
Lucien could feel a cloud of sleep stealing through his limbs .
As the ethereal strains of Ravel stole through the room , Penry let himself down on the sofa , eyes closed .
She could n't see the number from where she was , so she stole through the undergrowth and came up to it from behind .
The sight of them sent a warmth stealing through her veins , and she was afraid her new dress might soon smell of sweat like the old one .
His fingers stole to the buttons of her blouse , loosening their fragile hold on the flimsy cotton .
Allen stole forward to a point where he had a good view of the Waste .
It could not steal upon the country unaware , like a thief in the night .
Her hand stole up to cover his and gradually she rested herself back against him .
I will steal out of the door unperceived .
She stole away before anyone could talk to her .
Her only option would be to employ guile , and steal away when he was unaware of it .
Maybe ghosts steal back and invade you to inhabit you , because they 're lonely .
A little warmth stole back .
As he looked away from the board , her hand stole out and she moved a piece , neat as a thief in the market-place .
He stared at her , watching an expression of contempt steal over her face .
The sweet stillness of birdsong stole over the barge .
Jesus felt a gentle sense of irony steal over him .
She must be tired , for a delicious languor was stealing over her .
A grim expression stole over his face .
She felt the warmth of that kiss steal slowly up her arm and wrap itself around her heart .
I thought she had truly fallen asleep , until the young one stole up and told me . "
She stole up the staircase to his room , where she had not been since she was one of his students .
